operational constraints: Rovers and drones must recharge if energy drops below 30%
Rovers must enter a heat shelter during 20 minutes if surface temperature is below -60°C.
Rovers cannot operate if node temperature is below -80°C.
Rover's speed is reduced by 10% in rocky, 30% in sandy, 50% in icy, and 40% in crater terrains.
Rover's energy consumption varies: 5% in rocky, increased 10% in sandy, increased 20% in icy, and increased 15% in crater terrains.
Rovers may not operate in radioactive or unstable rocky terrain.
Rovers and drones must recharge if energy drops below 30%
Drones must return to base after 25 minutes of flight.
Drones are disabled if there is a dust storm.
Drones cannot operate if wind gusts exceed 40 km/h.
Satellites must maintain communication with the base station at N30 or N84 every 5 hours if they have to identify thermal anomalies.
Satellites cannot communicate in nodes with communication loss.
